intro: Cordia zedambae, commonly known as the Zedambae arbre de cuivre, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive copper-colored bark, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a rough texture. Cordia zedambae is often found in humid, lowland areas and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
